definition: vegetable or food basket/(fig.) food supply
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: It is suggested that the government should make efforts to set aside an appropriate fund for the vegetable basket program.
sentences.chinese: 人們建議政府應該做出努力，爲菜籃子工程撥出專款。

sentences.english: I have a basket full of fish, fruit, and vegetable, and hiking everyday.
sentences.chinese: 我有一個菜籃子，裝魚果蔬，天天健步。

sentences.english: So she bought one chop and put it in her market basket .
sentences.chinese: 於是她買了一根排骨並把它放進菜籃子裏。

sentences.english: Also, when foreigners read the "shopping basket project" in the newspaper, they feel confused.
sentences.chinese: 還有，比如說讀報課，閱讀課上踫到“菜籃子工程”。

sentences.english: The only new duty Kunta really hated was having to carry that basket for Bell every day .
sentences.chinese: 使昆塔唯一厭惡的新任務是每天替貝爾提菜籃子。

sentences.english: She bought one roll and put it in her market basket .
sentences.chinese: 她買了一個麪包卷，把它放進菜籃子裏。

sentences.english: Each participant received a $5 gift card which was entered into a draw for a prize basket.
sentences.chinese: 每位參賽者收到禮物卡500所簽訂了抽籤獎菜籃子。

definition: Haimen county level city in Nantong 南通[Nan2 tong1], Jiangsu
rich peasant/social class of people farming their own land, intermediate between land-owner class 地主[di4 zhu3] and poor peasant 貧農|贫农[pin2 nong2]
Beichen suburban district of Tianjin municipality 天津市[Tian1 jin1 shi4]
